definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to help/to assist/mutual assistance/to rush into or up/to raise or hold up/high/tall/old variant of 欀/chariot horse (old)/change (old)
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach

sentences.english: Presently she started up, exclaiming that they wouldbe late for breakfast;
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿她跳了起来，嚷着他们要耽误早饭了。

sentences.english: He hated the way I called him out.
sentences.chinese: 他其实很讨厌我那样冲他嚷。

sentences.english: Today, many publishers are tossing around ideas about charging for their online content.
sentences.chinese: 如今，很多出版商嚷着要对他们的在线新闻收费。

sentences.english: You know how I hate people who bawl all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我就看不惯那种成天嚷嚷嚷的人。

sentences.english: The children have been wanting me this half hour. ---Your's, very sincerely, M. GARDINER.
sentences.chinese: 我无法再写下去，孩子们已经嚷着要我要了半个钟头。

sentences.english: He almost snapped at me, All right.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎是冲我嚷道，“好吧。

sentences.english: The man felt irritated and shouted, “What the hell are you afraid of?
sentences.chinese: 那人便焦急起来，嚷道，“怕什么？

sentences.english: He exclaimed, still excited, willing to be angry at anyone for the moment .
sentences.chinese: 他嚷道，还是急躁得很，一时很想找什么人出出气。

sentences.english: Yelled Behrman. Who said I vill not bose?
sentences.chinese: 贝尔曼嚷道，谁说我不愿意来着？

sentences.english: Scarlett clapped a hand over the blubbery mouth.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉一手把那张哭嚷的嘴捂住了。

sentences.english: Father wanted to go to the country, but the children whooped it up for the beach.
sentences.chinese: 父亲想去乡下，但孩子们都嚷着要去海滨。

sentences.english: The city's oldest son for uprising and cried out for the second son of marcel induction headache.
sentences.chinese: 英熙为起义的大儿子和嚷着要烫发的二儿子感应头痛。

sentences.english: "This heat is stifling, " said Joe, wiping his forehead.
sentences.chinese: “真热得讨厌，”乔擦着额头的汗，嚷道。

definition: to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to murmur/to speak in a low voice
to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
